attributes.action: Class gyms as essential to allow for indoor exercise and for them to remain open
attributes.additional_details: Exercise ensures a healthy population&people who go to gyms have different goals&reasons for going, but one thing is clear it improves both physical&mental well-being. Allowing for outdoor only exercise does not allow all types of people to train in their chosen sport or to reach their goals which discriminates against people of different abilities and mental conditions. The weather in this country will prevent people going outside&dark nights and mornings and crime levels makeing it in safe.
attributes.background: To consider all gyms as essential to allow for all types of people to exercise in a safe in door environment by remaining open during lock down measures. How can you justify off licenses as essential unless you're encouraging alcoholism which is a strain on society, but I guess it's about tax...?

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
